tokens.resolved_gloss: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be a foreigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
tokens.translation: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be a foreigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery

tokens.resolved_gloss: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
tokens.translation: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
